Any readers "expecting a mea culpa from the famously cocksure Donald Rumsfeld will be disappointed" but nonetheless this is a clearly written work that attempts to cut through a number of myths to give a measured account of how things happened and why. Financial Times is more disparaging, describing the reading experience as a "long, hard slog, with little likelihood of emerging on the far side appreciably enlightened".
